ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and by a father and what he fathered,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the parent and the offspring,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and I swear by the parent and his offspring:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: or by the great father and his wonderful son (Abraham and Ishmael)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of your forefather Ibrahim, and by you – his illustrious son!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And by the begetter and that which he begot.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the begetter and whom he begot.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: by the begetter, and that he begot,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the begetter and that which he begat,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And by the begetter and that which he begat,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [and] by the father and him whom he begot:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And (the mystic ties of) parent and child;-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And by the begetter (i.e. Adam) and that which he begot (i.e. his progeny);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And by the giver of birth, and whom he fathered,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And by a father and what he fathered.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [90:3] And [by] the begetter, that is, Adam, and that which he begat, that is, his descendants (mā, ‘that which’, [actually] means man, ‘whom’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And the begetter and that which he begat) the begetter is Adam and that which his sons begat; and it is also said this means: the begetter refers to the person who can have children, whether this person is a man or a woman, while that which he begat refers to the men or women who cannot have children; Allah swore by all these,
